column2: This faction opposes the centralization of the [This.GetAdjective] government and wishes to grant greater autonomy to local governments.
This faction supports the centralization of the [This.GetFullName] and wishes to reduce the autonomy of local governments and increase the authority of the central government.

This faction opposes the current power of dictatorship that [This.Holder.GetFullName] holds over the [This.GetFullName], and wishes to found a democratic legislature by which any future laws must be approved.

The members of this faction believe that the [This.GetFullName] should be allowed to become a self-governing province of the [This.Holder.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], and support [New.GetFullName], [New.GetTitle] of [New.PrimaryTitle.GetName], as its first leader.

The members of this faction are no longer content with [This.Liege.GetFullName]'s administration or with [This.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] rule in general. They wish to declare independence and become their own sovereign states.

The members of this faction believe that the [This.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] needs peace. Some are dedicated pacifists, while others simply tire of the current wars. In either case, they will not vote for any new declarations of war, and may vote to abandon ongoing offensive wars.

The members of this faction are infuriated by the loss of [This.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] worlds to the enemy in recent years, and are willing to use military force to reclaim them. This faction supports Claim and De Jure wars.

The members of this faction are proud [This.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] patriots who refuse to allow their fellow citizens to suffer under foreign occupation. This faction supports Cultural Liberation wars.
Who's [Root.GetTitle], again? This menu opens decisions allowing you to change crown laws without needing to confirm them through a vote - although not always without consequences.
Order that the Senate dissolve and claim the power to rule by decree. This action will trigger a constitutional crisis.

You are the leader of the Anti-Centralization faction in the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Senate. With a majority in the Senate, and the support of the Prime Minister and Regent should either exist, you could pass a bill weakening the central government and giving more power to outlying sectors.

You are the leader of the Pro-Centralization faction in the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Senate. With a majority in the Senate, and the support of the Prime Minister and Regent should either exist, you could pass a bill strengthening the central government and taking away the privileges of outlying sectors.

You are the leader of a Home Rule faction in the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Senate. With a majority in the Senate, and the support of the Prime Minister and Regent should either exist, you could pass a bill granting an autonomous government to your homeland.

As leader of the Anti-Centralization faction in the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Senate, you have carefully crafted a bill that will reform the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], weakening the central government and increasing the autonomy of the outlying sectors. You have enough support to get this bill passed in the Senate.
And [Root.Liege.Regent.GetFullName] is already on our side!
